results.title: Icelandic
results.creator_credit: Eric Johnson and Icelandic Freezing Plant Corporation
results.brief_description: The frozen fish industry in Iceland. The ocean conditions that produce Iceland’s fishing grounds; the difficult ocean conditions around Iceland and the life of the fishermen; how the catch is processed; how to cook frozen fish. Also shows Iceland’s stark landscape and how her people depend upon the fishing industry.

results.title: I.A.A.F. track and field events, Helsinki
results.creator_credit: Guy Butler and International Amateur Athletic Federation
results.brief_description: Documentary highlights of the diverse sectors of the Helsinki 1952 Olympic Games ranging from the Opening Ceremony to specific events, ie field, high jump, long jump. Shows respective winners at these events and the lead up to their victory. Silent film with English subtext.

results.title: I Wouldn't Like to Be the Bait
results.brief_description: Take a wonderful journey through the rich and varied fishing areas of South Australia. A geographic presentation gives us not only a tapestry of the best fishing areas, but also a beautifully cinematic vision of the magnificent Southern Coastline. The Murray Valley, Coorong, Eyre and York Peninsulas, and the Spencer and Flinders Gulfs are explored, and sophisticated graphics give both an insight into the best season to fish and the species to be caught in those areas. A summary of the tourist facilities and other attractions is also presented, which makes this program the ideal guide to the coastal and freshwater recreational areas of South Australia.

results.title: I was there
results.creator_credit: Kristian Ryhammer, Central Film O and Teamfilm AS
results.brief_description: A survey of the modern integrated transport system in Norway - a rail ticket entitles you to travel by train, boat or bus and you may break your journey when and where you like. Shows the modern cities, historic buildings, old fishing villages and the spectacular scenery. (Awards: Lisboa)

results.title: I want to work
results.creator_credit: D Lynton Porter, Vroni Gordon and Central Council for Health Education
results.brief_description: Deals with the problems faced by epileptics seeking employment. Traces the career of a teenage girl on the point of leaving school who finds she is not wanted in any position because she is an epileptic. Finally she joins the British Epileptic Association which helps her to find employment and provides fellowship by the sharing of a common problem.

results.title: I dream of peace and rest: Norman Lindsay
results.brief_description: The opening of Norman Lindsay’s house by the National Trust. The house exhibits work by Norman Lindsay, including sculpture in the gardens. Lindsay’s thoughts and reflections on his life and work are heard, and many of his works of art are shown. Narrated by Margaret Throsby and Don Reid.

results.title: I am Tom Moody
results.brief_description:
As the performer steps up to the microphone, will the desire to make music be defeated by fears of failure and feelings of inadequacy? The awful solitude of the spotlight forces Tom to confront his inner critic.
Written, directed and animated by Ainslie Henderson.
Voices: Mackenzie Crook, Jude Crook, Rick Webster
Music: Peter Deane
Compositing: Will Anderson
Sound design: Ainslie Henderson, Joe Acheson

results.title: I am Joe's spine
results.brief_description: Uses three-dimensional animation and live sequences to provide an understanding of the complexity of the spine’s construction and an awareness of what can happen when the spine and its surrounding muscles are not given proper care.
